Package ohos.agp.text

Class DateFormat

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.agp.text.DateFormat

  • public class DateFormat
extends Object
    Provides a utility class to format the date text.
    Since:
    7

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods

      static CharSequence format​(long date)
      Formats the date text based on the default format of the current Locale.

    • Method Detail

      • format

        public static CharSequence format​(long date)
        Formats the date text based on the default format of the current Locale. For example, if the current Locale is US, the formatted string is similar to the following: "Thursday, April 22, 2021 at 3:45:01 PM Central Standard Time".
        Parameters:
        date - Indicates the number of milliseconds elapsed since the Unix epoch (00:00:00 UTC on January 1, 1970).
        Returns:
        Returns the formatted date and time string.
        Since:
        7

      • format

        public static CharSequence format​(long date,
                                  CharSequence format)
        Formats the date text in the specified format and the current Locale. In the specified format, the keyword y indicates the year, M indicates the month, and d indicates the day. You can also add text in '' format, for example, 'Today'. For details about the format keywords that can be entered, see the UDateFormatField keyword at the ICU website:
        Parameters:
        date - Indicates the number of milliseconds elapsed since the Unix epoch (00:00:00 UTC on January 1, 1970).
        format - Indicates the format to be specified.
        Returns:
        Returns the formatted date and time string.
        Since:
        7
        See Also:
        unicode Note: When format is null, the date text will be formatted in the default format of the current java.util.LocaleLocale.

      • format

        public static CharSequence format​(long date,
                                  CharSequence format,
                                  String locale)
        Formats the date text in the specified format and locale. In the specified format, the keyword y indicates the year, M indicates the month, and d indicates the day. You can also add text in '' format, for example, 'Today'. For details about the format keywords that can be entered, see the UDateFormatField keyword at the ICU website:
        Parameters:
        date - Indicates the number of milliseconds elapsed since the Unix epoch (00:00:00 UTC on January 1, 1970).
        format - Indicates the format to be specified.
        locale - Indicates the Locale to be specified. The value must be a valid character string representing Locale, for example, "en_US", or null.
        Returns:
        Returns the formatted date and time string.
        Since:
        7
        See Also:
        unicode Note: If locale is null, the current java.util.LocaleLocale will be used. If format is null, the date text will be formatted in the default format of the specified locale.

      • format

        public static CharSequence format​(String date,
                                  CharSequence format,
                                  String parseFormat)
        Formats the specified date text in the given format and the current Locale. This method cannot automatically identify the date format of the specified date string. You must use the parseFormat parameter to declare the date format. In the specified format, the keyword y indicates the year, M indicates the month, and d indicates the day. You can also add text in '' format, for example, 'Today'. For details about the format keywords that can be entered, see the UDateFormatField keyword at the ICU website:
        Parameters:
        date - Indicates the date string to be formatted.
        format - Indicates the format to be specified.
        parseFormat - Indicates the format in which the date string is to be parsed. For example, if the specified date text is "20210405", the parseFormat value is "yyyyMMdd".
        Returns:
        Returns the formatted date and time string.
        Since:
        7
        See Also:
        unicode Note: If any input parameter is set to null, date will be returned without formatting.

      • format

        public static CharSequence format​(String date,
                                  CharSequence format,
                                  String parseFormat,
                                  String locale)
        Formats the specified date text in the given format and locale. This method cannot automatically identify the date format of the specified date string. You must use the parseFormat parameter to declare the date format. In the specified format, the keyword y indicates the year, M indicates the month, and d indicates the day. You can also add text in '' format, for example, 'Today'. For details about the format keywords that can be entered, see the UDateFormatField keyword at the ICU website:
        Parameters:
        date - Indicates the date string to be formatted.
        format - Indicates the format to be specified.
        parseFormat - Indicates the format in which the date string is to be parsed. For example, if the specified date text is "20210405", the parseFormat value is "yyyyMMdd".
        locale - Indicates the Locale to be specified. The value must be a valid character string representing Locale, for example, "en_US", or null.
        Returns:
        Returns the formatted date and time string.
        Since:
        7
        See Also:
        unicode Note: If locale is null, the current java.util.LocaleLocale will be used. If any input parameter except locale is set to null, date will be returned without formatting.
